text:
We have a number of Windows Server 2012 R2 systems that could not be upgraded in
time for the Server 2012 October 10, 2023 EOL date, and yes, the plan is to get
the remaining 2012 systems upgraded or replaced by a supported OS. In the
meantime we have purchased ESU licenses. The problem we are having is with the
new ESU licenses applied to our systems, they are not detecting any of the
latest 2012 security patches, and yes, the prerequisite ESU patch, and the
servicing stack update from June of 2023 are installed. The problem appears to
be that detection is failing -- both from our internal WSUS server as well as
directly from Microsoft. Is anyone else experiencing this issue? I have a
support call scheduled with Microsoft today to work on this issue. 
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/kb5031043-procedure-to-continue-receiving-security-updates-after-extended-support-has-ended-on-october-10-2023-c1a20132-e34c-402d-96ca-1e785ed51d45
 
<

metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] Windows Server 2012 R2 ESU Issue
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from roger.padilla@ucsb.edu. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
We have a number of Windows Server 2012 R2 systems that could not be upgraded in
time for the Server 2012 October 10, 2023 EOL date, and yes, the plan is to get
the remaining 2012 systems upgraded or replaced by a supported OS. In the
meantime we have purchased ESU licenses. The problem we are having is with the
new ESU licenses applied to our systems, they are not detecting any of the
latest 2012 security patches, and yes, the prerequisite ESU patch, and the
servicing stack update from June of 2023 are installed. The problem appears to
be that detection is failing -- both from our internal WSUS server as well as
directly from Microsoft. Is anyone else experiencing this issue? I have a
support call scheduled with Microsoft today to work on this issue. 
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/kb5031043-procedure-to-continue-receiving-security-updates-after-extended-support-has-ended-on-october-10-2023-c1a20132-e34c-402d-96ca-1e785ed51d45
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Ftopic%2Fkb5031043-procedure-to-continue-receiving-security-updates-after-extended-support-has-ended-on-october-10-2023-c1a20132-e34c-402d-96ca-1e785ed51d45&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7Ce4becb5d02df420e295908dc11464937%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638404241701585813%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C41000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=K0uqhiKIL2zCenvt1x4R6Db1YFkwOM7TubklqY8VSLs%3D&reserved=0] 
<><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><><> 
Roger Padilla, Jr., CISSP
